## Section B

```{r Importing Data}
# Import files
# SAS
library(haven)
employees <- read_sas("employees.sas7bdat")

# SPSS
health <- read_sav("health.sav")

# Stata
surveydata <- read_dta("surveydata.dta")

# CSV
library(readr)
products <- read_csv("product.csv")

# Excel (sheet 2)
library(readxl)
attendance <- read_excel("attendance.xlsx", sheet = 1)

# Load iris dataset
data(iris)

# Export iris to various forms
# CSV
write_csv(iris, "iris.csv")

# Excel
# Load writexl package
install.packages("writexl")
library(writexl)
write_xlsx(iris, "iris.xlsx")

# SPSS
write_sav(iris, "iris.sav")

# SAS
write_sas(iris, "iris.sas7bdat")

# Stata
write_dta(iris, "iris.dta")
```

### SECTION C

```{r EDA}
# First and last 8 rows of iris
head(iris, 8)
tail(iris, 8)

# Structure of iris
str(iris)

# Mean of Sepal.Length and Standard deviation of Petal.Width
mean(iris$Sepal.Length)
sd(iris$Petal.Width)

# Frequency table of the variable Species
table(iris$Species)

# Average Sepal.Length grouped by Species
library(dplyr)
iris %>%
  group_by(Species) %>%
  summarise(Average_Sepal_Length = mean(Sepal.Length))

# Remove the dataset iris from your environment
rm(iris)
```

#### SECTION D

```{r Data Visualization}
# Load ggplot2
library(ggplot2)

# A histogram of Sepal.Length from iris
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5, fill = "blue", color = "black")

# A scatter plot of Sepal.Length vs Petal.Length with points colored by Species
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Petal.Length, color = Species)) +
  geom_point()

# A boxplot of Sepal.Width grouped by Species
ggplot(iris, aes(x = Species, y = Sepal.Width, fill = Species)) +
  geom_boxplot()
```

##### SECTION F

```{r Applied Case Study}

# Load fivethirtyeight package and bechdel dataset
library(fivethirtyeight)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
data(bechdel)

# Number of films that passed the Bechdel test
sum(bechdel$binary == "PASS")

# Decade with the highest number of movies recorded
bechdel %>%
  mutate(decade = (year %/% 10) * 10) %>%
  count(decade, sort = TRUE)

# Subset the dataset to include only films after the year 2000
bechdel_after2000 <- subset(bechdel, year > 2000)

# Bar plot for movies that passed vs failed the Bechdel test
ggplot(bechdel, aes(x = binary)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  labs(title = "Bechdel Test Results",
       x = "Result",
       y = "Number of Films")
```
